intro: Dugandiodendron urraoense, commonly known as the Urrao tree, is a rare and endemic plant species found in the mountainous regions of Colombia. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, broad leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in spring. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in shaded, humid environments. Its unique morphology and restricted distribution make it an important subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
